page.title: 17Children's Leisure
page.content: Television occupied children for the greatest amount of their leisure time. Some children watched an average of two and a half hours each week day and three and a half at the week end. Many children had a video at home which enabled them to hire videos. They seem to watch the same video several times. Computers were available in many homes and some children had become addicted to games like 'Frogger'. BMX bikes are the craze in the summer evenings with most children performing tricks on the quiet estate roads. Snooker has become very popular as a result of television coverage. The tables seem to have taken over the family garage. The older boys go fishing in the River Nene usually unaccompanied by an adult. There seemed to be very few family outings with them taking place every other month.
